mechanoreception.notes: As brachiopods, Discinidae likely possess mechanoreceptors for sensing water currents and substrate vibrations. This is inferred based on the general biology of brachiopods and their sessile lifestyle.

chemoreception.notes: Discinids likely use chemoreception to detect food particles and assess water quality. This is inferred from the feeding biology of similar filter-feeding invertebrates.

photoreception.notes: The presence or absence of photoreceptors in Discinidae is currently unknown based on provided context. Further research is needed.
